Section titled “Method 2: Local Development”

Clone and use directly:

Skill 1: docx-format-replicator

Section titled “Skill 1: docx-format-replicator”

Extract formatting from existing Word documents and generate new documents with the same format.

Use Cases

Section titled “Use Cases”
  • Corporate document template replication - Maintain consistent branding across documents
  • Batch document generation - Create multiple documents with identical formatting
  • Technical specification series - Generate spec documents from templates
  • Standardized documentation - Development task sheets, reports, etc.

Section titled “Usage Example”

“I have a document template and need to generate 5 new documents with the same format”

Claude will automatically identify and invoke the appropriate skill.

Skill 2: video-processor

Section titled “Skill 2: video-processor”

Download and process videos from YouTube and other platforms. Supports video download, audio extraction, format conversion, and Whisper transcription.

Use Cases

Section titled “Use Cases”
  • Download videos from YouTube and other platforms
  • Extract audio from video files
  • Convert videos to MP4/WebM formats
  • Transcribe audio/video to text using Whisper

Skill 3: wechat-article-writer

Section titled “Skill 3: wechat-article-writer”

Automated WeChat article writing workflow with 4 steps: research, writing, title generation, and formatting optimization.

Use Cases

Section titled “Use Cases”
  • Write WeChat official account articles
  • Generate viral headlines
  • Content creation for self-media
  • Article formatting and optimization

Workflow

Section titled “Workflow”

The skill follows a 4-step process:

  1. Research - Gather information on the topic
  2. Writing - Generate article content
  3. Title Generation - Create engaging headlines
  4. Formatting - Optimize for WeChat’s editor

Section titled “Why These Skills Matter”

Claude Code’s plugin system enables community contributions that extend the tool’s capabilities beyond its core features. The happy-claude-skills collection demonstrates practical applications:

  1. Document automation - Reduces manual formatting work
  2. Media processing - Brings video handling capabilities into the coding workflow
  3. Content creation - Streamlines article writing for Chinese audiences

As the Claude Code ecosystem grows, we can expect more community plugins to emerge, further enhancing the tool’s versatility.

KestrelAI: Long-term Research Assistants with Self-Scheduling

Dec 28, 2025
Vibe Sparking

KestrelAI: Long-term Research Assistants with Self-Scheduling

Section titled “KestrelAI: Long-term Research Assistants with Self-Scheduling”

In the world of AI research assistants, most tools focus on quick, one-shot responses. KestrelAI takes a different approach—it’s a local-first research assistant that self-schedules and executes support tasks over long horizons, allowing you to stay focused on complex, novel work while it handles mechanical tasks in the background.

What is KestrelAI?

Section titled “What is KestrelAI?”

Kestrel is a local-first research assistant designed for long-running research tasks. What makes it unique:

  • Self-Scheduling: Automatically plans and schedules work, tracks progress, and pivots when stalled
  • Long-Horizon Execution: Runs for hours or days, providing auditable checkpoints for review
  • Local-First: Built to run on small LLMs (1-7B) via Ollama—laptop/desktop friendly
  • Source Provenance: Maintains clear records of consulted searches and their impact on findings

GitHub Repository: dankeg/KestrelAI Author: Ganesh Danke License: MIT

The Problem Kestrel Solves

Section titled “The Problem Kestrel Solves”

When doing deep research work, you often encounter time-consuming mechanical tasks:

  • Comparing tools and frameworks
  • Gathering real-world usage examples
  • Extracting performance claims from documentation
  • Assembling comprehensive comparisons

These tasks interrupt your flow on the actual novel work. Kestrel handles this background research, surfacing organized evidence when you need it.

Example Use Case

Section titled “Example Use Case”

Imagine you’re interpreting a frontier research paper and planning a novel study. You need to decide between Polars vs. pandas vs. Spark for your data processing.

Instead of spending hours manually researching, you tell Kestrel:

“Compare Polars, pandas, and Spark for data processing. Gather real-world usage, performance benchmarks, and use case recommendations.”

Kestrel then runs in the background:

  1. Searches for documentation and benchmarks
  2. Filters relevant sources
  3. Extracts performance claims
  4. Assembles a reviewable comparison

Hours later, you have an organized report ready for analysis—not scattered across browser tabs.

Architecture

Section titled “Architecture”

Kestrel uses a two-agent architecture:

Research Agent

Section titled “Research Agent”

Executes concrete micro-tasks:

  • Search → Retrieve → Filter → Extract → Narrow summary
  • Proposes specific follow-ups when evidence warrants it

Orchestrator

Section titled “Orchestrator”

Plans and coordinates the overall effort:

  • Schedules work across agents
  • Tracks progress and blockers
  • Pivots when stalled
  • Emits checkpoints you can accept or adjust

Orchestrator Profiles

Section titled “Orchestrator Profiles”
ProfileScope & BehaviorTypical Runtime
HummingbirdQuick breadth-first sweeps; targeted lookupsMinutes–~2h
KestrelMedium-horizon exploration with closely related branchesMulti-hour
AlbatrossLong-horizon, open-ended exploration with reviewsDay-scale+

The names are mnemonic—community-authored profiles with clear behaviors are welcome.

Tech Stack

Section titled “Tech Stack”
  • Backend: FastAPI
  • Frontend: React
  • Middleware: Redis
  • Model Runner: Ollama

More model engines and integrations are under development!

Installation

Section titled “Installation”

Prerequisites

Section titled “Prerequisites”
  • Ollama - Recommended for Apple Silicon (GPU passthrough limitations)
  • Docker Desktop

Quick Start

Section titled “Quick Start”

After a few minutes of building, the application launches at http://localhost:5173/.

Alternative: Pre-built Images

Section titled “Alternative: Pre-built Images”

Images are built through GitHub Actions:

Usage

Section titled “Usage”

Using Kestrel is straightforward:

  1. Create a new task with a description
  2. Set a time-box for the research
  3. Monitor progress via the dashboard
  4. Review checkpoints and redirect if needed
  5. Export results when complete

The dashboard lets you track:

  • Searches and resulting sources
  • Checkpoints and reports
  • Agent progress and status

Key Features

Section titled “Key Features”

Task Exploration

Section titled “Task Exploration”

Kestrel doesn’t just follow a linear path—it leverages gathered evidence to iterate on tasks, identifying and pursuing new branches as they emerge from the research.

Source Provenance

Section titled “Source Provenance”

Every search and its impact on findings is recorded, creating an auditable trail of how conclusions were reached.

Long-Running Support

Section titled “Long-Running Support”

Instead of a single final report, Kestrel surfaces checkpoints throughout the process, allowing for course correction and redirection.

Small LLM Friendly

Section titled “Small LLM Friendly”

Designed to run efficiently with models in the 1-7B parameter range via Ollama—no GPU cluster required.

Development Status

Section titled “Development Status”

Kestrel is actively developed with regular updates. Check the GitHub Issues for:

  • Top feature requests (add your 👍 votes)
  • Bug reports and known issues
  • Community discussions

Contributing

Section titled “Contributing”

All contributions are appreciated! Kestrel is meant to be a practical, community-focused project. Areas of contribution:

  • New orchestrator profiles for specific use cases
  • Additional model engine integrations
  • UI/UX improvements
  • Documentation and examples

See CONTRIBUTING.md for guidelines.

Why Kestrel Matters

Section titled “Why Kestrel Matters”

Most AI tools optimize for quick responses. Kestrel optimizes for deep, sustained research that happens alongside your core work. By running locally and respecting resource constraints, it makes AI-powered research assistance accessible without:

  • Expensive API subscriptions
  • Privacy concerns with cloud services
  • Dependency on internet connectivity

It’s research assistance that works on your terms, with your hardware, and for your timeline.

  • MIT License
  • GitHub Discussions

Quotio: Stop Juggling AI Accounts - A macOS Menu Bar App That Unifies Claude, Gemini, OpenAI, Qwen, and Antigravity

Dec 28, 2025
Vibe Sparking

Quotio: Stop Juggling AI Accounts

Section titled “Quotio: Stop Juggling AI Accounts”

Stop juggling AI accounts. Quotio is a beautiful native macOS menu bar app that unifies your Claude, Gemini, OpenAI, Qwen, and Antigravity subscriptions – with real-time quota tracking and smart auto-failover for AI coding tools like Claude Code, OpenCode, and Droid.

Introduction: The AI Account Management Problem

Section titled “Introduction: The AI Account Management Problem”

As developers, we increasingly rely on multiple AI coding assistants in our daily work. You might use Claude Code for intelligent code completion, GitHub Copilot for inline suggestions, Cursor for AI-powered IDE features, and various OpenAI-based tools for different tasks. Each service comes with its own:

  • Subscription and billing
  • API keys and authentication
  • Usage quotas and rate limits
  • Separate dashboard and management interface

This fragmentation creates constant overhead. You’re juggling multiple browser tabs, switching between different CLI configurations, and inevitably hitting rate limits on one service while another sits idle. Enter Quotio – a unified solution that brings all your AI subscriptions under one roof.

What is Quotio?

Section titled “What is Quotio?”

Quotio is a native macOS application that provides unified quota monitoring and request routing for multiple AI provider services. Created by developer Trong Nguyen (nguyenphutrong), Quotio serves two complementary purposes:

  1. Visual Dashboard – Track all your AI API usage limits in one beautiful interface
  2. Optional Local Proxy – Route requests across multiple provider accounts with intelligent load balancing and failover

Dual-Mode Architecture

Section titled “Dual-Mode Architecture”

Quotio offers two operation modes to suit different needs:

Quota-Only Mode

Section titled “Quota-Only Mode”

A lightweight mode perfect for users who simply want visibility into their AI usage:

  • Real-time quota tracking by reading authentication files from installed CLI tools
  • Support for Claude Code, Codex CLI, Gemini CLI, GitHub Copilot, Cursor, and Antigravity
  • macOS menu bar integration for at-a-glance quota status
  • System notifications for low quota warnings
  • No proxy server required – minimal resource footprint

Full Mode

Section titled “Full Mode”

All Quota-Only features plus powerful proxy capabilities:

  • Local proxy server for request routing and load balancing
  • OAuth-based provider authentication
  • Automatic failover between accounts when quotas are exhausted
  • API key management for secure proxy access
  • Comprehensive usage statistics and request logging
  • Automatic configuration of CLI agents to use the proxy

Core Features

Section titled “Core Features”

1. Multi-Provider Support

Section titled “1. Multi-Provider Support”

Quotio unifies 10 AI providers in a single interface:

ProviderQuota-Only ModeFull Mode
Claude✅✅
Gemini✅✅
OpenAI✅✅
Qwen✅✅
Antigravity✅✅
GitHub Copilot✅✅
Cursor✅✅
Codex CLI✅✅

2. Real-Time Quota Tracking

Section titled “2. Real-Time Quota Tracking”

The menu bar integration provides at-a-glance quota status:

  • Provider symbol (1-2 letters) + lowest percentage across models
  • Example: "G:95% C:42% CP:88%" (Gemini 95%, Claude 42%, Copilot 88%)
  • Color-coded indicators: green (>50%), orange (20-50%), red (<20%)
  • Customizable display options – show/hide providers, change color modes

3. Smart Auto-Failover

Section titled “3. Smart Auto-Failover”

In Full Mode, Quotio acts as an intelligent proxy:

When one account hits its quota limit, Quotio automatically routes requests to another available account, ensuring uninterrupted workflow.

4. Menu Bar Integration

Section titled “4. Menu Bar Integration”

The persistent macOS menu bar presence keeps you informed without interrupting your workflow:

  • Always-visible quota status
  • Quick access to detailed dashboard
  • Low quota notifications
  • Language support: English and Vietnamese

Installation and Setup

Section titled “Installation and Setup”

Prerequisites

Section titled “Prerequisites”
  • macOS 14.6 or later
  • Accounts with supported AI providers (Claude, Gemini, OpenAI, etc.)

Getting Started

Section titled “Getting Started”
  1. Download Quotio from the GitHub Releases page
  2. Launch the app and complete the onboarding flow
  3. Choose your mode: Quota-Only (lightweight) or Full (with proxy)
  4. Connect your accounts via OAuth or manual authentication
  5. Configure your coding tools to use the Quotio proxy (Full Mode)

Agent Configuration

Section titled “Agent Configuration”

For AI coding tools, Quotio provides automatic configuration:

Use Cases and Best Practices

Section titled “Use Cases and Best Practices”

For Individual Developers

Section titled “For Individual Developers”

Scenario: You’re a developer using Claude Code for daily work, but you also have access to Gemini and OpenAI APIs for side projects.

Solution: Quotio lets you see all your quotas at a glance and automatically routes requests when one provider is exhausted.

For Teams

Section titled “For Teams”

Scenario: Your team has multiple AI subscriptions across different providers, and team members frequently hit rate limits during peak hours.

Solution: Configure Quotio with multiple accounts per provider for intelligent load distribution and automatic failover.

For Cost Optimization

Section titled “For Cost Optimization”

Scenario: You want to maximize usage of your AI subscriptions before upgrading to higher tiers.

Solution: Use Quotio’s detailed usage statistics to understand consumption patterns and make informed decisions about subscription upgrades.

Technical Architecture

Section titled “Technical Architecture”

Built with modern macOS development practices:

  • Framework: SwiftUI with AppKit integration
  • Architecture: MVVM with Actor Model for thread-safe services
  • Concurrency: Swift Concurrency (async/await, actors)
  • Localization: English and Vietnamese support
  • Auto-Updates: Sparkle framework for seamless updates

The project structure follows clean architecture principles:

Future Roadmap

Section titled “Future Roadmap”

As of version 0.2.2, Quotio is actively developed with recent additions including:

  • Quota-Only Mode for lightweight usage
  • Cursor support
  • Enhanced proxy management
  • Internationalization support

Check the CHANGELOG.md for the latest updates.

Conclusion

Section titled “Conclusion”

Quotio solves a real pain point for developers who use multiple AI services. By providing unified quota monitoring, intelligent request routing, and seamless failover, it transforms the fragmented experience of managing multiple AI subscriptions into a cohesive, productive workflow.

Whether you’re an individual developer juggling personal AI subscriptions or part of a team with multiple provider accounts, Quotio offers the tools you need to maximize your AI productivity.

Download Quotio today: github.com/nguyenphutrong/quotio
